intro: Sida pilosella, commonly known as silky sida, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, soft stems and small, pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are ovate with a hairy texture, and it produces capsules as its fruit. Sida pilosella is often found in disturbed soils and is adaptable to various environmental conditions.
